channel.title: BUbreakingSectionTwo
channel.description: This is a randomly ordered feed of the most recent entries from BUbreakingSectionTwo, skipping any feeds with errors.

item.title: Herzi Halevi, Israel’s Military Chief, to Step Down Over Hamas Attack
item.description: Lt. Gen. Herzi Halevi, who has commanded the Israeli military throughout 15 months of war in Gaza, said he was resigning over its failure to protect a...

item.title: Vivek Ramaswamy’s departure as DOGE co-czar removes growing political liability for Elon Musk
item.description: The added controversy around Ramaswamy is the last thing Elon Musk needs as he races to cut $1 trillion from the federal budget before the 2026 midter...

item.title: Wind Power in U.S. Faces Hit From Trump’s Executive Order
item.description: In a sweeping order, President Trump halted federal approvals for new wind farms, in a move that could affect projects on land and in the ocean.

item.title: Israeli Settlers Attack Palestinian Villages in the West Bank
item.description: Jewish extremists burned buildings and vehicles in raids on Palestinian villages in the West Bank late Monday, Palestinian officials and the Israeli m...

item.title: Rubio Oversees Halt to Foreign Aid and Meets With Asian Diplomats on Day 1
item.description: Marco Rubio told State Department employees that changes under President Trump “are not meant to be destructive, they’re not meant to be punitive.”

item.title: Steve Davis was Elon Musk’s chief cost-cutter at X and the Boring Company. DOGE might be his next big project
item.description: Former coworkers describe Davis's ruthless focus on efficiency, which could be perfect for cutting government bloat.

item.title: Wind Power in U.S. Faces Hit From Trump’s Executive Order
item.description: In a sweeping order, President Trump halted federal approvals for new wind farms, in a move that could affect projects on land and in the ocean.

item.title: Elon Musk’s X and Bluesky look to cash in on TikTok uncertainties with new video features
item.description: X and Bluesky have announced they are launching custom video feeds as TikTok faces an uncertain future in the U.S.

item.title: Garth Hudson, Multifaceted Musician With the Band, Dies at 87
item.description: He was the last surviving original member of one of the most influential groups of the 1960s and ’70s, with its blend of rock, r&b and country.

item.title: Israel Embarks on an ‘Extensive’ Military Operation in the West Bank
item.description: The announcement came shortly after President Trump rescinded Biden-era sanctions on Israeli settlers and Jewish extremists raided Palestinian village...

item.title: Herzi Halevi, Israel’s Military Chief, to Step Down Over Hamas Attack
item.description: Lt. Gen. Herzi Halevi, who has commanded the Israeli military throughout 15 months of war in Gaza, said he was resigning over its failure to protect a...

item.title: Hegseth Ex-Sister-in-Law Tells Senators He Was ‘Abusive’ to Second Wife
item.description: A woman once married to the brother of Pete Hegseth, the defense secretary nominee, submitted a sworn statement to the Senate in a late-hour complicat...

item.title: TikTok is safe for now, but X and Bluesky are launching similar-looking vertical video feeds to take its place should the ban hammer come down again
item.description: Instagram, meanwhile, is working on a CapCut clone.

item.title: Stock market winners and losers on Trump’s second day in office
item.description: Overall, markets rose, as Trump eased investors’ fears about his line on tariffs.

item.title: Rubio Oversees Halt to Foreign Aid and Meets With Asian Diplomats on Day 1
item.description: Marco Rubio told State Department employees that changes under President Trump “are not meant to be destructive, they’re not meant to be punitive.”
